entries.meaning: A hard stroke, hit or blow, e.g., as part of a spanking.
Alternate spelling of swot: vigorous study at an educational institution.

verbs.description: swat (third-person singular simple present swats, present participle swatting, simple past and past participle swatted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To beat off, as insects; to bat, strike, or hit.
examples: He swatted the mosquito that was buzzing around in his bedroom.
The cat swatted at the feather.

verbs.description: swat (third-person singular simple present swats, present participle swatting, simple past and past participle swatted)

entries.meaning: (US, slang, transitive) To illegitimately provoke a SWAT assault upon (someone).
